actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to enhance beneficiary access to quality health care services under the medicare program.
short_title: Revitalizing Underserved Rural Areas and Localities (RURAL) Act of 2002
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Revitalizing Underserved Rural Areas and Localities (RURAL) Act of 2002 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSA) with respect to the Medicare inpatient hospital prospective payment system and rural and small urban areas. Provides for acceleration of the rate of reduction of beneficiary copayment liability under the Medicare hospital outpatient department prospective payment system.Includes certain other measures designed to assist rural areas. Provides for a full market basket increase in FY 2003 for Medicare hospitals in rural and small urban areas. Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to increase the payment amount for home health services furnished in a frontier or rural area from April 1, 2003 to March 31, 2006.Revises requirements with respect to critical access hospitals, providing coverage of costs for certain emergency room on-call providers. Provides for coverage of air ambulance services, including services requested by a Federal or State agency to relocate patients following a natural disaster, an act of war, or a terrorist attack.

titles.title: Revitalizing Underserved Rural Areas and Localities (RURAL) Act of 2002
A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to enhance beneficiary access to quality health care services under the medicare program.
